text:
Problem 2.3

Bagging Snacks: Least Common Multiple or Greatest Common Factor?

We have looked at problems about revolutions of Ferris wheels and life cycles of Cicadas. Multiples were useful in solving those problems. This problem involves packing snacks for a hiking trip. Consider the following questions as we work on this problem:

Are the features of this problem like previous problems?

What features of the structure of numbers might be helpful in solving this problem?
